DOC.brief_summary: The study compare analgesic efficacy transversus abdominis plane block wound infiltration parturients undergo cesarean delivery spinal anesthesia .
DOC.brief_title: Transversus Abdominis Plane Block Versus Wound Infiltration Postcesarean Analgesia
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , control , double-blind study conduct ASA physical status II parturients full-term singleton pregnancy undergo elective cesarean delivery spinal anesthesia . Patients receive either ultrasound-guided transversus abdominis plane block wound infiltration end surgery . After delivery , patient receive standard analgesia ( intravenous ketorolac oral paracetamol ) patient-controlled analgesia intravenous fentanyl . Total fentanyl consumption 24 h , pain score 2 , 4 , 6 , 12 , 24 h , side effect , patient satisfaction compare 2 group .
DOC.criteria: 1 . American Society Anesthesiologists physical status II 2 . Fullterm singleton pregnancy 1 . Age < 19 > 40 year 2 . Height < 150 cm 3 . Weight < 60 kg 4 . Body mass index â‰¥40 kg/m2 5 . Contraindications spinal anesthesia ( patient refusal , increase intracranial tension , coagulopathy , uncorrected hypovolemia ) 6 . Hypersensitivity drug use study 7 . Significant cardiovascular , renal , hepatic disease 8 . Known fetal abnormality 9 . Emergency situation
